name: Barren Dolf
description: The proprietor of the Niktogauss delivery service, Barren is a gruff, no-nonsense man whose hardened exterior was earned from a lifetime on the unforgiving streets. He is stout, with a network of wrinkles around his eyes and a voice that sounds like grinding stones. He has a soft spot for the street kids he employs, though he'd never admit it.
personality_traits: Fair, in his own gruff way
Nostalgic for his younger, wilder days
ideals: Business: 'A coin earned is a coin deserved. No more, no less.'
Survival: 'The city doesn't care if you live or die. You gotta make it care.'
Aspiration: 'Keep your head down, do the work, and you might just make it to tomorrow.'
bonds: The Niktogauss delivery service, his life's work.
The network of street urchins and runners he employs, including Cade.
A faded tattoo from a gang he left long ago.
flaws: Distrustful of anyone who hasn't earned their calluses.
Resistant to change and new ways of doing things.
His pragmatism can sometimes border on callousness.
backstory: Barren Dolf wasn't always a business owner. In his youth, he was a runner and low-level rogue, learning the hard way that a quiet life is a long life. He scraped together enough coin to start the Niktogauss service, a name he picked because it sounded impressive and nobody knew what it meant. He provides a semi-legitimate enterprise for kids on the street, giving them a chance he never really had. He eventually sold the service to the bard Threestrings.
motivations: To keep his business afloat and his runners safe.
To maintain his small pocket of influence in the city's street-level economy.
To see the kids he hires, like Cade, make something of themselves.
knowledge: An encyclopedic knowledge of the city's shortcuts, back alleys, and rooftops.
The gossip and rumors that travel through the network of city runners.
How to spot trouble from a mile away.
speech_patterns: Short, clipped sentences. Liberal use of street slang.
mannerisms: Squints when assessing someone. Constantly wiping his hands on a rag tucked into his belt.
gm_notes: Barren can be a source of local quests, information, or a safe contact for the party in the city. He values loyalty and payment in equal measure. He knows more about the city's criminal element than he lets on.
